As I have mentioned earlier, I have been thinking about this group.

Right =
now, settings are such that non-members can post with posts by
non-members =
being moderated.  That's become problematic.  Everyday,
this group recieves=
 quite a few pieces of spam coming from
non-members, and frankly I don't ha=
ve the time or inclination to track
down where the spam is originating from=
.  Deleting spam won't be a
problem except every 2-3 days, it's 12 pending =
messages that are spam
waiting to be deleted.  I know yahoo groups has a se=
tting where
pending messages are automatically deleted within some days if =
they
aren't touched.  My original intent in letting non-members post was to=

remove obstacles for conversation.  At this point, I think it's too
much t=
rouble to allow non-members to be able to post so I am changing
settings ba=
ck where only members can post.

In other news, it's going to be a long whi=
le before I get back to work
on my own scenario editor, unless a multitude =
of feedback shows up. 
Why?  I am working on revamping a website to run off=
 mysql and php. 
Right now, I'm guessing I have over 200 pages of data entr=
y commands
(and growing) (I'm in the middle of fixing some things so I can'=
t
exactly put all the data entry commands in a single file; last time it
wa=
s in a single file - it was 168 pages of data entry commands.).
